definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To create (a hole ) by removing material with a drill ( tool ) .
examples: Drill a small hole to start the screw in the right direction.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To practice, especially in (or as in) a military context.
examples: They drilled daily to learn the routine exactly.

definitions.definition: ( ergative ) To cause to drill ( practice ) ; to train in military arts.
examples: The sergeant was up by 6:00 every morning, drilling his troops.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To repeat an idea frequently in order to encourage someone to remember it.
examples: The instructor drilled into us the importance of reading the instructions.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , figurative ) To investigate or examine something in more detail or at a different level
examples: Drill deeper and you may find the underlying assumptions faulty.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To throw , run , hit or kick with a lot of power.
examples: He drilled down the court and made a three-pointer.
He drilled the ball to his teammate.

definitions.definition: ( baseball ) To hit someone with a pitch, especially in an intentional context.
( slang , vulgar ) To have sexual intercourse with; to penetrate .
( slang ) To shoot ; to kill by shooting.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To create (a hole ) by removing material with a drill ( tool ) .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To practice, especially in (or as in) a military context.

( transitive ) To repeat an idea frequently in order to encourage someone to remember it.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To sow (seeds) by dribbling them along a furrow or in a row.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To sow (seeds) by dribbling them along a furrow or in a row.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause to flow in drills or rills or by trickling; to drain by trickling.
examples: waters drilled through a sandy stratum

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause to flow in drills or rills or by trickling; to drain by trickling.

definitions.definition: To protract , lengthen out; fritter away , spend (time) aimlessly.
examples: Quit purposely drilling out the time hoping that someone else will do your chores.

definitions.definition: To entice or allure ; to decoy ; with on .
To cause to slip or waste away by degrees.

main_definition: ( transitive , obsolete or dialectal ) To protract , lengthen out; fritter away , spend (time) aimlessly.

( transitive , obsolete or dialectal ) To cause to slip or waste away by degrees.
